headline: Trump Says He's Planning 100% Tariff on Chips
summary: President Donald Trump said Wednesday afternoon during an Oval Office event that he would be imposing 100% tariff rates on all computer chips and semiconductors imported into the U.S.  The president added that all such products developed in the U.S. would not be subject to the tariff.  If companies are in the process of building in the U.S., they wouldn't be subject to the levy.

raw.headline: Trump Says He's Planning 100% Tariff on Chips
raw.summary: President Donald Trump said Wednesday afternoon during an Oval Office event that he would be imposing 100% tariff rates on all computer chips and semiconductors imported into the U.S.  The president added that all such products developed in the U.S. would not be subject to the tariff.  If companies are in the process of building in the U.S., they wouldn't be subject to the levy.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow, Nasdaq Finish Higher As Apple Surges; Chip Leader Dives On Earnings

Blue-chip McDonald's, Advanced Micro Devices, and Super Micro Computer were among earnings movers in the stock market today.

headline: The AI Trade Is More Than Just Nvidia and AMD. 2 Other Stocks to Consider.
summary: Nvidia  the world’s biggest chip maker, is often described as the “pick and shovel” provider for the new technology’s massive investment story.  Earnings from  Advanced Micro Devices Arista Networks  and  Astera Labs  suggest that there are subtle ways to play the trade.  Much like the Gold Rush of the mid-19th century, where hundreds of prospectors went bust but the sellers of gold-digging equipment made a fortune, chip makers are expected to capitalize on the AI investment regardless of who emerges victorious.

headline: Morning Bid: When the chips are down
summary: A mix of disappointing results from some major semiconductor chip names, a service sector hiccup and another slight ebb in hopes for interest rate cut have caused early week stock market ebullience go a bit flat.  * Chips stocks were side-swiped as Advanced Micro Devices reported disappointing data center revenue, a segment including artificial intelligence chips, causing shares in the California-based company to slump 4% overnight.  * Despite the dour ISM services reading, Federal Reserve easing speculation declined slightly, with markets now only pricing in an 80% chance of a cut next month compared to essentially 100% at this time yesterday.

raw.headline: Morning Bid: When the chips are down

headline: S&P 500, Dow futures buoyed by earnings, Fed rate cut hopes
summary: (Reuters) -S&P 500 and Dow futures climbed on Wednesday, as investors assessed a fresh round of corporate earnings, while renewed optimism that the Federal Reserve will soon deliver long-awaited interest rate cuts kept markets buoyant.  Adding to the uncertainty, Trump will decide on a nominee to replace outgoing Fed Governor Adriana Kugler by the end of the week, while saying he narrowed the possible replacements for Fed Chair Jerome Powell to a short list of four.

headline: S&P Futures Gain With Focus on Earnings and Fed Speak
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are trending up +0.24% this morning as investors digested U.S. President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats and weak economic data, with the focus now shifting to a fresh batch of corporate earnings reports and remarks from Federal Reserve officials.

headline: How AI stocks and earnings are driving the market rally
summary: You can catch Trader Talk on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Is this bull market stronger than Wall Street thinks? On this episode of Trader Talk, Kenny Polcari and Bullseye Brief founder Adam Johnson explain why artificial intelligence (AI)–driven capital spending, strong earnings, and resilient consumer demand could push stocks even higher. They reveal how savvy investors are reading earnings reports for future signals and why the Federal Reserve may not need to cut rates as soon as traders expect. Watch more episodes of Trader Talk here. Trader Talk with Kenny Polcari on Yahoo Finance delivers expert analysis and actionable insights, empowering you to navigate market volatility and secure your financial future. This post was written by Langston Sessoms.

headline: AMD's Upbeat Forecast Overshadowed by China Warning
summary: Advanced Micro Devices, as part of its quarterly earnings report Tuesday, declined to predict Chinese sales of the Instinct MI308, an AI processor that the company designed for the Asian country, overshadowing a generally upbeat forecast for its AI business. Peter Elstrom reports on Bloomberg Television.

raw.headline: AMD's Upbeat Forecast Overshadowed by China Warning

Peter Elstrom reports on Bloomberg Television.

headline: AMD, Super Micro shares slide as AI bets falter on data center results miss
summary: Shares of chip company Advanced Micro Devices and server maker Super Micro Computer tumbled in premarket trading on Wednesday after the companies posted underwhelming results in their data center segments, shaking investor confidence in their AI growth narratives. AMD dropped 7%, while Super Micro plummeted about 17%. The selloff comes as chipmakers face mounting headwinds, including weak demand, rising inventories, and the threat of new U.S. tariffs on semiconductor imports, expected as early as next week.

headline: AMD Gives a Strong Outlook. Why the Stock Is Falling.
summary: Advanced Micro Devices reported better-than-expected revenue results Tuesday afternoon.  The stock pointed 5.4% lower at $164.99 in premarket trading Friday.  The chip maker reported second-quarter adjusted earnings per share of 48 cents, in line with Wall Street’s consensus estimate, according to FactSet.

headline: Markets Rebounding as Solid Earnings Outweigh Tariff and Stagflation Fears
summary: Stocks were set to rebound on Wednesday as investors looked past President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats and more data that pointed to U.S. economic weakness.  All three of the blue-chip indexes finished in the red the previous session after Trump said he would soon unveil tariff rates for semiconductors and pharmaceuticals and the Institute for Supply Management’s services industry survey unexpectedly fell.  Moves on Wednesday “may reverse some of Tuesday’s late selloff,” Kathleen Brooks, research director at the foreign exchange brokerage XTB, said.

headline: Gaming GPU Industry Report 2025 | Push for High Frame Rates and 4K/8K Resolution Propels Demand for Advanced Graphics Processing Units
summary: Offering a detailed analysis, the report covers key trends, drivers, and market forecasts, essential for informed business decisions. Highlighted are the latest global tariff impacts on the market. Gaming GPUs are critical for rendering lifelike graphics and powering immersive experiences, essential for VR, AR, and cloud gaming. Major growth is noted in both dedicated and integrated segments, with a spotlight on the U.S. and China's growth trajectory. Key players include AMD, NVIDIA, and Intel.
